class.name: ResourceLoader
class.brief_description: A singleton for loading resource files.
class.description: A singleton used to load resource files from the filesystem. It uses the many [ResourceFormatLoader] classes registered in the engine (either built-in or from a plugin) to load files into memory and convert them to a format that can be used by the engine. [b]Note:[/b] You have to import the files into the engine first to load them using [method load]. If you want to load [Image]s at run-time, you may use [method Image.load]. If you want to import audio files, you can use the snippet described in [member AudioStreamMP3.data]. [b]Note:[/b] Non-resource files such as plain text files cannot be read using [ResourceLoader]. Use [FileAccess] for those files instead, and be aware that non-resource files are not exported by default (see notes in the [FileAccess] class description for instructions on exporting them).

method.name: add_resource_format_loader
method.description: Registers a new [ResourceFormatLoader]. The ResourceLoader will use the ResourceFormatLoader as described in [method load]. This method is performed implicitly for ResourceFormatLoaders written in GDScript (see [ResourceFormatLoader] for more information).

method.name: exists
method.description: Returns whether a recognized resource exists for the given [param path]. An optional [param type_hint] can be used to further specify the [Resource] type that should be handled by the [ResourceFormatLoader]. Anything that inherits from [Resource] can be used as a type hint, for example [Image]. [b]Note:[/b] If you use [method Resource.take_over_path], this method will return [code]true[/code] for the taken path even if the resource wasn't saved (i.e. exists only in resource cache).

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_file_extension
method.description: Returns cached resource paths whose file extension exactly matches [param file_extension]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] Cache contains [code]res://icon.svg[/code], [code]res://art/logo.svg[/code], [code]res://data/config.tres[/code]. [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_extension("svg", false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://icon.svg", "res://art/logo.svg"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_extension("svg", true, "|")[/code] → [code]["Image|res://icon.svg", "Image|res://art/logo.svg"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] where keys are cached paths and values are their Godot types, filtered by exact [param file_extension]. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_dict("svg")[/code] → [code]{ "res://icon.svg": "Image", "res://art/logo.svg": "Image" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_dict("tres")[/code] → [code]{ "res://data/config.tres": "Resource" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_prefix
method.description: Returns cached paths whose file extension starts with [param file_extension_prefix]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] Cache contains [code]res://clip.ogg[/code], [code]res://voice.oga[/code], [code]res://movie.ogv[/code]. [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_prefix("og", false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://clip.ogg", "res://voice.oga", "res://movie.ogv"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_prefix("og", true, "|")[/code] → [code]["AudioStreamOggVorbis|res://clip.ogg", "AudioStreamOggVorbis|res://voice.oga", "VideoStream|res://movie.ogv"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_prefix_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] mapping paths to types for items whose file extension starts with [param file_extension_prefix]. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_prefix_dict("og")[/code] → [code]{ "res://clip.ogg": "AudioStreamOggVorbis", "res://voice.oga": "AudioStreamOggVorbis" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_prefix_dict("ts")[/code] → [code]{ "res://cutscene.tsbc": "VideoStream", "res://track.tscn": "PackedScene" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_substring
method.description: Returns cached paths whose file extension contains [param file_extension_substr]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] Cache contains [code]res://font.ttf[/code], [code]res://font.otf[/code], [code]res://image.tga[/code]. [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_substring("tf", false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://font.ttf"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_substring("ot", true, "|")[/code] → [code]["FontFile|res://font.otf"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_substring_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] mapping paths to types for entries whose extension contains [param file_extension_substr]. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_substring_dict("tf")[/code] → [code]{ "res://font.ttf": "FontFile" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_extension_substring_dict("tg")[/code] → [code]{ "res://image.tga": "Image" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_file_name
method.description: Returns cached paths whose base file name exactly matches [param file_name] (no directories). [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] Cache contains [code]res://icon.svg[/code], [code]res://art/icon.svg[/code]. [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_name("icon.svg", false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://icon.svg", "res://art/icon.svg"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_name("icon.svg", true, "|")[/code] → [code]["Image|res://icon.svg", "Image|res://art/icon.svg"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_file_name_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] mapping paths to types for entries with base name [param file_name]. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_name_dict("icon.svg")[/code] → [code]{ "res://icon.svg": "Image", "res://art/icon.svg": "Image" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_name_dict("menu.tscn")[/code] → [code]{ "res://scenes/menu.tscn": "PackedScene" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_file_name_prefix
method.description: Returns cached paths whose base file name starts with [param file_name_prefix]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] Cache contains [code]res://ui/button_play.png[/code], [code]res://ui/button_stop.png[/code]. [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_name_prefix("button_", false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://ui/button_play.png", "res://ui/button_stop.png"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_name_prefix("button_", true, "|")[/code] → [code]["Image|res://ui/button_play.png", "Image|res://ui/button_stop.png"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_file_name_prefix_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] mapping paths to types for entries whose base file name starts with [param file_name_prefix]. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_name_prefix_dict("button_")[/code] → [code]{ "res://ui/button_play.png": "Image", "res://ui/button_stop.png": "Image" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_name_prefix_dict("tile")[/code] → [code]{ "res://tileset/tile_grass.png": "Image" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_file_name_substring
method.description: Returns cached paths whose base file name contains [param file_name_substr]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] Cache contains [code]res://icon.svg[/code], [code]res://art/app_icon.png[/code], [code]res://ui/button.png[/code]. [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_name_substring("icon", false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://icon.svg", "res://art/app_icon.png"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_name_substring("icon", true, "|")[/code] → [code]["Image|res://icon.svg", "Image|res://art/app_icon.png"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_file_name_substring_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] mapping paths to types for entries whose base file name contains [param file_name_substr]. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_name_substring_dict("icon")[/code] → [code]{ "res://icon.svg": "Image", "res://art/app_icon.png": "Image" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_file_name_substring_dict("menu")[/code] → [code]{ "res://scenes/menu.tscn": "PackedScene" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_path_prefix
method.description: Returns cached paths beginning with [param path_prefix]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] Cache contains [code]res://scenes/menu.tscn[/code], [code]res://scenes/game.tscn[/code], [code]res://assets/atlas.png[/code]. [code]get_cached_paths_by_path_prefix("res://scenes/", false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://scenes/menu.tscn", "res://scenes/game.tscn"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_path_prefix("res://scenes/", true, "|")[/code] → [code]["PackedScene|res://scenes/menu.tscn", "PackedScene|res://scenes/game.tscn"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_path_prefix_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] mapping paths to types for cached entries beginning with [param path_prefix]. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_path_prefix_dict("res://scenes/")[/code] → [code]{ "res://scenes/menu.tscn": "PackedScene", "res://scenes/game.tscn": "PackedScene" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_path_prefix_dict("res://assets/")[/code] → [code]{ "res://assets/atlas.png": "Image" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_path_substring
method.description: Returns cached paths containing [param path_substr] anywhere in the path. [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] Cache contains [code]res://ui/button.png[/code], [code]res://scenes/ui/hud.tscn[/code], [code]res://scenes/game.tscn[/code]. [code]get_cached_paths_by_path_substring("/ui/", false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://ui/button.png", "res://scenes/ui/hud.tscn"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_path_substring("/ui/", true, "|")[/code] → [code]["Image|res://ui/button.png", "PackedScene|res://scenes/ui/hud.tscn"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_path_substring_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] mapping paths to types for entries containing [param path_substr] anywhere in the path. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_path_substring_dict("/ui/")[/code] → [code]{ "res://ui/button.png": "Image", "res://scenes/ui/hud.tscn": "PackedScene" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_path_substring_dict("/audio/")[/code] → [code]{ "res://audio/click.wav": "AudioStreamWAV" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_resource_name
method.description: Returns cached paths whose resource name exactly matches [param resource_name]. [i]The resource name is the internal name stored in the resource.[/i] [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_resource_name("PlayerAtlas", false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://textures/player.png"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_resource_name("MainMenu", true, "|")[/code] → [code]["PackedScene|res://scenes/menu.tscn"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] mapping paths to types for entries whose resource name exactly matches [param resource_name]. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_dict("PlayerAtlas")[/code] → [code]{ "res://textures/player.png": "Image" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_dict("MainMenu")[/code] → [code]{ "res://scenes/menu.tscn": "PackedScene" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_prefix
method.description: Returns cached paths whose resource name starts with [param resource_name_prefix]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_prefix("Enemy", false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://textures/enemy.png", "res://scenes/EnemyBoss.tscn"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_prefix("Enemy", true, "|")[/code] → [code]["Image|res://textures/enemy.png", "PackedScene|res://scenes/EnemyBoss.tscn"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_prefix_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] mapping paths to types for entries whose resource name starts with [param resource_name_prefix]. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_prefix_dict("Enemy")[/code] → [code]{ "res://textures/enemy.png": "Image" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_prefix_dict("Level")[/code] → [code]{ "res://scenes/Level1.tscn": "PackedScene", "res://scenes/Level2.tscn": "PackedScene" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_substring
method.description: Returns cached paths whose resource name contains [param resource_name_substr]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_substring("Atlas", false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://textures/PlayerAtlas.png", "res://textures/EnemyAtlas.png"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_substring("Menu", true, "|")[/code] → [code]["PackedScene|res://scenes/menu.tscn", "Theme|res://ui/menu_theme.tres"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_substring_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] mapping paths to types for entries whose resource name contains [param resource_name_substr]. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_substring_dict("Atlas")[/code] → [code]{ "res://textures/PlayerAtlas.png": "Image", "res://textures/EnemyAtlas.png": "Image" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_resource_name_substring_dict("Menu")[/code] → [code]{ "res://scenes/menu.tscn": "PackedScene", "res://ui/menu_theme.tres": "Theme" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_type_hint
method.description: Returns cached paths whose inferred or declared type matches [param type_hint]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_type_hint("PackedScene", false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://scenes/menu.tscn", "res://scenes/game.tscn"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_type_hint("Image", true, "|")[/code] → [code]["Image|res://icon.svg", "Image|res://textures/player.png"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_by_type_hint_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] mapping paths to types for entries matching [param type_hint]. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_type_hint_dict("Image")[/code] → [code]{ "res://icon.svg": "Image", "res://textures/player.png": "Image" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]get_cached_paths_by_type_hint_dict("Theme")[/code] → [code]{ "res://ui/theme.tres": "Theme" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths
method.description: Returns all cached resource paths as a [PackedStringArray]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = false):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths(false, "|")[/code] → [code]["res://icon.svg", "res://scenes/menu.tscn", "res://audio/click.wav"][/code]. [b]Example (with_godot_type = true, separator = "|"):[/b] [code]get_cached_paths(true, "|")[/code] → [code]["Image|res://icon.svg", "PackedScene|res://scenes/menu.tscn", "AudioStreamWAV|res://audio/click.wav"][/code].

method.name: get_cached_paths_dict
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] with all cached paths as keys and their Godot types as values. [b]Example 1:[/b] [code]{ "res://icon.svg": "Image", "res://scenes/menu.tscn": "PackedScene" }[/code]. [b]Example 2:[/b] [code]{ "res://audio/click.wav": "AudioStreamWAV", "res://textures/player.png": "Image" }[/code].

method.name: get_cached_ref
method.description: Returns the cached resource reference for the given [param path]. [b]Note:[/b] If the resource is not cached, the returned [Resource] will be invalid.

method.name: get_dependencies
get_recognized_extensions_for_type
method.description: Returns the list of recognized extensions for a resource type.

method.name: get_resource_uid
method.description: Returns the ID associated with a given resource path, or [code]-1[/code] when no such ID exists.

method.name: has_cached
method.description: Returns whether a cached resource is available for the given [param path]. Once a resource has been loaded by the engine, it is cached in memory for faster access, and future calls to the [method load] method will use the cached version. The cached resource can be overridden by using [method Resource.take_over_path] on a new resource for that same path.

method.name: list_directory
method.description: Lists a directory, returning all resources and subdirectories contained within. The resource files have the original file names as visible in the editor before exporting. The directories have [code]"/"[/code] appended. [codeblock] # Prints ["extra_data/", "model.gltf", "model.tscn", "model_slime.png"] print(ResourceLoader.list_directory("res://assets/enemies/slime")) [/codeblock] [b]Note:[/b] The order of files and directories returned by this method is not deterministic, and can vary between operating systems. [b]Note:[/b] To normally traverse the filesystem, see [DirAccess].

method.name: load
method.description: Loads a resource at the given [param path], caching the result for further access. The registered [ResourceFormatLoader]s are queried sequentially to find the first one which can handle the file's extension, and then attempt loading. If loading fails, the remaining ResourceFormatLoaders are also attempted. An optional [param type_hint] can be used to further specify the [Resource] type that should be handled by the [ResourceFormatLoader]. Anything that inherits from [Resource] can be used as a type hint, for example [Image]. The [param cache_mode] property defines whether and how the cache should be used or updated when loading the resource. Returns an empty resource if no [ResourceFormatLoader] could handle the file, and prints an error if no file is found at the specified path. GDScript has a simplified [method @GDScript.load] built-in method which can be used in most situations, leaving the use of [ResourceLoader] for more advanced scenarios. [b]Note:[/b] If [member ProjectSettings.editor/export/convert_text_resources_to_binary] is [code]true[/code], [method @GDScript.load] will not be able to read converted files in an exported project. If you rely on run-time loading of files present within the PCK, set [member ProjectSettings.editor/export/convert_text_resources_to_binary] to [code]false[/code]. [b]Note:[/b] Relative paths will be prefixed with [code]"res://"[/code] before loading, to avoid unexpected results make sure your paths are absolute.

method.name: load_threaded_get
method.description: Returns the resource loaded by [method load_threaded_request]. If this is called before the loading thread is done (i.e. [method load_threaded_get_status] is not [constant THREAD_LOAD_LOADED]), the calling thread will be blocked until the resource has finished loading. However, it's recommended to use [method load_threaded_get_status] to known when the load has actually completed.

method.name: load_threaded_get_status
method.description: Returns the status of a threaded loading operation started with [method load_threaded_request] for the resource at [param path]. An array variable can optionally be passed via [param progress], and will return a one-element array containing the ratio of completion of the threaded loading (between [code]0.0[/code] and [code]1.0[/code]). [b]Note:[/b] The recommended way of using this method is to call it during different frames (e.g., in [method Node._process], instead of a loop).

method.name: load_threaded_request
method.description: Loads the resource using threads. If [param use_sub_threads] is [code]true[/code], multiple threads will be used to load the resource, which makes loading faster, but may affect the main thread (and thus cause game slowdowns). The [param cache_mode] parameter defines whether and how the cache should be used or updated when loading the resource.

method.name: remove_resource_format_loader
method.description: Unregisters the given [ResourceFormatLoader].

method.name: set_abort_on_missing_resources
method.description: Changes the behavior on missing sub-resources. The default behavior is to abort loading.

constants.constant: The resource is invalid, or has not been loaded with [method load_threaded_request].
The resource is still being loaded.
Some error occurred during loading and it failed.
The resource was loaded successfully and can be accessed via [method load_threaded_get].

Neither the main resource (the one requested to be loaded) nor any of its subresources are retrieved from cache nor stored into it. Dependencies (external resources) are loaded with [constant CACHE_MODE_REUSE].

The main resource (the one requested to be loaded), its subresources, and its dependencies (external resources) are retrieved from cache if present, instead of loaded. Those not cached are loaded and then stored into the cache. The same rules are propagated recursively down the tree of dependencies (external resources).

Like [constant CACHE_MODE_REUSE], but the cache is checked for the main resource (the one requested to be loaded) as well as for each of its subresources. Those already in the cache, as long as the loaded and cached types match, have their data refreshed from storage into the already existing instances. Otherwise, they are recreated as completely new objects.
Like [constant CACHE_MODE_IGNORE], but propagated recursively down the tree of dependencies (external resources).
Like [constant CACHE_MODE_REPLACE], but propagated recursively down the tree of dependencies (external resources).
